messageBody:
Hi,

I am actually relatively new to Junit testing and I have a quick question
about running tests on two different threads. I am trying to verify that
something is done on the swing thread with a junit test. For example the
following:

SwingUtilities.invokeLater(new Runnable(){
public void run() {
assertEquals(2, tableModel.getRowCount());
};

});

When this test actually fails I've noticed an AssertionError exception is
thrown on the Swing thread but the test overall still passes.

My question is this: is there a way to make the test not pass when this
assert fails? Or at least throw the AssertionError on the Junit thread
instead of the Swing thread?

Thanks for any help,
Aaron
